abstract.text: A generic protocol used to identify objects that describe a capability.

inlineContent.text: Abstractly describes the types of operations, metadata, or additional information that can be associated with IDX remediations or authenticators.

IDX is inherently extensible and is highly metadata-driven. Some authenticators or remediations can have additional information or actions associated with them, depending on the type involved. To simplify how you interact with these objects, these are decomposed into a set of Capability objects that describes their function.
At its core, there are two primary types of capabilities:
and
.  The full list of capabilities can be retrieved using the
property, or convenience functions are provided to return the appropriate values as an Optional.
Capability Type
Convenience Property
Description
Represents a User Verification (UV) number challenge, for example within a Okta Verify push notificatio challenge.
Provides details on the password complexity settings required.
Allows the client to poll the authenticator when an out-of-band challenge is underway.
Provides additional profile information related to the authenticator.
Enables the user can begin a recovery process for this authenticator.
Represents an action the user can perform to send an out-of-band challenge or request using this authenticator.
Allows an authenticator to resend an out-of-band challenge using this authenticator.
Provides details about authenticators that provide a time-based one-time-password.
Capability Type
Convenience Property
Description
Allows the client to poll a remediation when the user has begun an out-of-band challenge.
Provides additional information required when a user selects an authentication using a Social IDP.
The
protocol is used by a class or struct to represent actions or information available on an object that conforms to
, which then references an enum that implements the
protocol.

abstract.text: Authenticate users using policy-driven native authentication with the Okta Identity Engine.
Represents information describing the available authenticators and enrolled authenticators.
Enumeration describing the individual type of capability available within
objects, and its associated underlying
instance.
Exposes information related to multiple-choice number challenges.
Exposes data assocated with one-time-password authenticator enrollment handling.
Exposes this authenticator’s password settings, if available.
Exposes the authenticator’s ability to poll for an out-of-band result.
Exposes profile information that may be associated with the user account, or this authenticator.
Exposes the authenticator’s capability to recover this authenticator.
Exposes the authenticator’s capability to resend a code.
Exposes the authenticator’s capability to send a code.

Describes choices the user can make to proceed through the authentication workflow.

instance.
Exposes the remediation’s ability to poll for an out-of-band result.
For Social IDP remediation options, this value will describe information related to the social provider, and the resources needed to proceed through this remediation step.
